articles.title: EU medicines regulator warns on COVID booster shot frequency - Seeking Alpha
articles.description: Repeat booster dosing may have the unintended consequence of weakening the immune response, according to a top official with the European Medicines Agency.

articles.title: Frequent COVID Booster Shots Could Weaken Immunity: European Medicines Agency - The Quint
articles.description: The announcement comes in the backdrop of several countries now considering the possibility of offering second booster shots to people for added protection against surging Omicron infections.
articles.content:
The European Medicines Agency (EMA) warned on Tuesday, 11 January, that frequent booster shots could have the opposite effect and weaken the immune system, reported Bloomberg.

articles.description: There is a “closing window of opportunity” for countries to prevent their health systems from being overwhelmed, the WHO has warned.
articles.content:
Over half of all Europeans will be infected with Covid-19 in the next 6-8 weeks, the World Health Organisation has warned.
